result.execSummary:
The defendant Panda Lee Halfaday was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department

Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: fines/fees/costs added to payment plan $25 per week

The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days. 
NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH J.C.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not be present where alcohol or MAS are consumed.
Participate in Batterer's Intervension Program

AODA assessment and after-care as recommended by her AODA counselor Laura Moore and therapist Todd Swanson.
Sign release to DOC. Provide last name of Dr. David and list prescriptions you are taking

records.addlTxt: after probation review hearing

Defendant Panda Lee Halfaday not in court. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin.; DOC reports has paid all obligations, has a job, no issues while on probation, agent feels ok to discharge; Ct allows to discharge from probation as scheduled;
for probation review

Defendant Panda Lee Halfaday in court. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Was suppose to be here at 8:00 a.m.  arrived at 8:34 a.m;  woke up at exactly 8:00 a.m.; works at Moccassin Trail Center, gets home after midnight; Did sign release of information; Tracy is DOC agent; waiting for opening in domestic violence class; set current on payment plan, next payment due September 6, 2016; warrant canceled;
Defendant Panda Lee Halfaday not in court. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin.; Ct orders warrant for defendant for failure to appear
Probation review hearing on September 1, 2016 at 08:00 am.
state's recommendations

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Perrine, client should be here shortly. 8:38 on the record. State complied with vic rights. No agreement on sent, ADA comments on recommendation. Motion for admission for Other Acts Evidence. Atty Perrine comments on sentencing. Sentence (see attached notes)

Defendant Panda Lee Halfaday in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin via the phone. agreement to the plea but not sentencing. will plea as charged. Charged with DC. understands. Pleas No contest. signed plea questionnaire. no threat or force. no mind altering. sub. Ct finds plea is know. and vol entered. Accepts plea and finds G. would like sent after June 15 for a half hr.  Bond cont.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 12:30 pm.
